_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Central Irrigation & Fertilizer Corp. complies with ANSI K-61-1 requirements for anydrous ammonia storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  We are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Henderson Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

The primary purpose of this facility is storage of fertilizers for sale to the agricultural sector.
Anydrous Ammonia is received, sotred and distributed for direct application. 

We used RMP Comp to determine the worst case scenario release at our facility.  Failure of my largest storage tank when filled to the greatest amount would have off site consequences.  We have these passive and active migigation devices including drains, excess flow valves, relief valves, check valves, and manual shut-off valves.  The alternative release scenario is based on the most likely incident to occur which is a break in a transfer hose.

We comply with all applicable state codes and regulations and have attended Ammonia Safety and Maintenance School sponsored by the Nebraska Fertilizer Ag-Chem Association.

We never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

The emergency response program is in the event of an emergency involving our ammonia anhydrous system, it is our policy to notify the Henderson Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department:  members of the fire department have inspected our system.  The facility has provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required by SARA Title III (EPCRA).

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are
no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendation for implementation at this time.
